title: An Ohio Republican's Response To Obama's ISIS Strategy
teaser: Ohio Republican Mike Turner says he is concerned the President will walk away from Iraq and Syria.
contentencoded:
Ohio Republican Mike Turner, who sits on the House Armed Services Committee, joins Here & Now‘s Robin Young to discuss President Obama’s strategy to stop the militant group known as the Islamic State.

Turner says Obama “began to make a case” last night for addressing the threat posed by the Islamic State and that airstrikes in Syria must be a part of the solution.

But he says he is concerned the President will once again walk away from Iraq and Syria.

Guest

  • Rep. Mike Turner, Republican Congressman representing Ohio’s 10th district. He tweets @RepMikeTurner.
